    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.swing.JDialog getDialog()
      Return's the actual JDialog instance that is the root for the components of the colour-chooser.

      The colour-choosers JDialog should never be modified by another class except by itself.
      Adding listeners to it is an exception, as they don't actually change the JDialog.
      int getLeftColour()
      Returns the 'Left' (primary) colour.
      int getRightColour()
      Returns the 'Right' (secondary) colour.
      int getSelectedEditColor() 
      void hide()
      This method makes the colour-chooser invisible again.
      boolean isVisible()

      Changes the 'Left' (primary) colour to the given color.
      void setRightColour(int packedColorARGB)
      Changes the 'Right' (secondary) colour to the given color.
      void setSelectedEditColour(boolean isEditingLeft) 
      void setSelectedEditColour(int c) 
      void setSelectedEditColour(int c, boolean invert)

      This method makes the colour-chooser show up.
      void toggle()
      This method toggles the visibility of the colour-chooser.

      void updateAllChooserSubComponents_EditChanged()

      • getDialog

        public javax.swing.JDialog getDialog()
        Return's the actual JDialog instance that is the root for the components of the colour-chooser.

        The colour-choosers JDialog should never be modified by another class except by itself.
        Adding listeners to it is an exception, as they don't actually change the JDialog.
        Returns:
        The colour-choosers JDialog instance.

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Returns:
        True, if the chooser is currently visible. False if not.
